description: Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 14 to allow the sales and servicing of motor cars, motorcycles and commercial vehicles pursuant to planning permission P/1999/3279 dated 02/12/1999.
decision_conditions: Deleted. | The hours of operation of the proposed workshop and valeting area shall be restricted to 8.00 hours to 18.00 hours Monday to Friday, 9.00 hours to 15.00 hours on Saturday and not at any time on Sunday or Bank Holidays.
Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties.

| All machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustics standard not exceeding NR35 measured or calculate the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is closer.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties.

| Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendation of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction Of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS5489 part 9 must be submitted in writing to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the development commencing. The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of the premises and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area.
| The landscaping scheme shown on Drawing No.NMGB26/42/C & NG Landscape plan dated 1/10/97 implemented pursuant to the approval dated 28/10/97 (Ref. 11991/4/C) shall be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the development remains landscaped in the interests of the visual character of the area.
| The screen walls and fences shown on Drawing No. MGB26/45, NMGB26/43B, NMGB26/42C, NMGB26/04/H implemented pursuant to the approval dated 28/10/97 (Ref.11991/4/G) shall be permanently retained.
Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring properties.
| The area shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas shall be kept clear and used for these purposes only, and shall not be used for any other purposes.
Reason: In the interests of Highway Safety.

| Details of access and provision for the needs of people with disabilities shown on the Drawing No. NMG26/42C, NMG26/09A, NMG26/08/C & NMG26/07B, implemented pursuant to the approval dated 23/9/97 (Ref.11991/4/D) shall be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for the people with disabilities.

| The details of noise and vibration suppression measures /structural details of workshop and acoustic barrier detailed in the report TR589 and shown on Drawing No. NMG26/43/B, NMG26/07/B, NMG26/04/G, NMG26/11/B, implemented pursuant to the approval dated 13/01/98 (Ref: 11991/4/) shall be permanently retained.
Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties.
| The exhaust and ventilation system shown on Drawing No.1599/1. Implemented pursuant to the approval dated 13/1/98 (Ref: 11991/4/H) shall be permanently retained.
Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties.

| Deliveries to the site shall be undertaken from the slip road off North Circular Road only and any deliveries and loading /unloading on the site audible at any adjoining residential properties shall be restricted to 07.00 hours - 19.00 hours Monday to Saturday and not at any time on Sunday or bank Holidays.
Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties.

| There shall be no vehicular ingress or egress to and from the application site from the eastern side, and that the existing opening shall be used only as an emergency means of escape and for no other purpose.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and to deter the use of Iveagh Avenue for parking by potential customers.
| All repairs and maintenance cleaning shall be restricted to the workshop areas as shown on the approved drawings No. NMGB26/04/L AND BD.43.01B.
Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties.

| The premises shall be used for the sales and servicing of motor cars, motorcycles and commercial vehicles and for no other purpose without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers.

| There shall be no new openings in the eastern elevation, and that details of measures to alarm the existing emergency exit to prevent its use for any other purpose and to ensue it is kept closed are submitted to and approved in writing prior to any development taking place on the site, and such measures as approved shall be implanted prior to first occupation and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties.
